oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: The McGavock residence, "Carnton," in Franklin, Tennessee.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Carnton Plantation was a profitable, large-scale farming operation established in 1826 by Randal McGavock, a former mayor of Nashville. When John and Carrie McGavock lived in the home in 1864, it served as a field hospital during the Battle of Franklin.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: RG 82: Tennessee Department of Conservation Photograph Collection, 1937-1976
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Dwellings; Architectural elements; Porches; Automobiles
